summary: Experienced, multilingual human rights activist and content writer with a demonstrated history of working in writing and editing with a passion for human rights and technology; including the intersection of the two. Skilled in travel photography, translation, and journalism. Interested in research, art, documentaries, literature and cinematography. Strong experience in political journalism and currently pursuing a research master’s degree in Cultures of Arts, Science and Technology with a focus on Human-Robot relations and Gender from Maastricht University. Lately, tackling the art of podcasting.

treasury_media.title: Make women feel safe again.
treasury_media.description: It’s late at night and you are a woman walking home. Alone. You have your keys between your fingers (a trick passed down for generations), your headphones are off and you are looking behind your back every few seconds. You notice someone following you.

treasury_media.title: Maastricht Diplomat - Abortion rights: Europe's legal legacy
treasury_media.description: In this episode, the team jumps into the first of three episodes, where they discuss the realities of abortion and reproductive rights. This episode focuses on the legal and historical facts that have shaped abortion rights across Europe.

treasury_media.title: MDfm: Carnival Special by Student Radio Maastricht
treasury_media.description: In this addition to MDfm's podcast series, they talk all things Carnival. Such things include: drinking, partying, wild costumes, and the occasional contagious pathogen. Enjoy!

profile_positions.description: Member of the Research and Academia team of UM Pride, the LGBTQIA+ Network platform for all lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer & allied staff members and students at the University of Maastricht. Currently, working on making a University wide database on Gender and Diversity Researchers and/or Teachers.
profile_positions.title: Research and Academia member

profile_positions.description: Student Research Assistant for the "BioMe: Existential challenges and ethical imperatives of biometric AI in everyday lifeworlds" project in Uppsala University, Sweden. During the course of the internship I took part in the Research Seminar Series Undisciplined Ethics and AI arranged within the nationwide research program The Wallenberg AI, Autonomous Systems and Software Program – Humanities and Society (WASP-HS), which is organized by Professor Amanda Lagerkvist and colleagues. Furthermore, I assisted in seminars, workshops, project meetings and conferences and assisted the group with setting up and managing a Twitter account for research communication. During the course of the internship I also did a reading course on Sex and Intimacy Robotics, which resulted in a text seminar given by me for the research group.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Member of the Educational Programme Committee of the Student Representatives for the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences of Maastricht University for 2020-2021. Member of the (F)DIAS inner group, where my team and I focus on issues regarding the facilities, diversity, integration, accessibility and sustainability of the faculty. We work closely with fellow student representatives and the faculty staff, including the Dean and the Programme Directors, not only as representatives but also policy advisors.
profile_positions.title: Student Representative / Educational Programme Committee

profile_positions.description: Elected member of the Faculty Council for the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences of Maastricht University for 2019-2020. Member of the Student Representatives of the faculty, where my team and I focus on issues regarding the facilities, diversity, integration, accessibility and sustainability of the faculty. We work closely with fellow student representatives and the faculty staff, including the Dean, not only as representatives but also policy advisors.
profile_positions.title: Student Representative / Faculty Council Member

volunteer_experiences.description: I am enrolled as a volunteer in GloVo Greece, and I have participated in a lot of voluntary actions, especially for visually impaired people, and people with kinetic dissabilities.

company.name: The International Conference on Enabling Access for Persons  with Visual Impairment (ICEAPVI)

volunteer_experiences.description: Bloode is an online service that helps address the need of blood in Greece, while aiming to increase the number of blood donors and to organise the country’s blood giving system.

A 3-day festival to honor and celebrate the International Day of Persons with Disabilities (3/12) and the International Day of Volunteerism (5/12).
The organisation's aim was to raise awareness for people with disabilities, show the greatness of being a volunteer and discover how one can put a piece into changing the world.
